meanings.definition: Capable of regenerating or being regenerated
meanings.sent1: The regenerative powers of nature allow forests to grow back after a fire.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a regenerative treatment to help heal the injured muscle.
meanings.sent3: The regenerative lotion promised to make wrinkles disappear overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was like a regenerative force, bringing new life to the team.
meanings.sent5: The regenerative energy of the sun fuels the growth of plants.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to renew or restore
meanings.sent1: The regenerative properties of the soil help plants thrive.
meanings.sent2: The regenerative power of forgiveness can mend broken relationships.
meanings.sent3: The regenerative rain shower washed away all the worries from her mind.
meanings.sent4: His regenerative spirit lifted the mood of everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The regenerative cycle of the seasons brings new life to the land.

meanings.definition: Relating to the process of growth and renewal
meanings.sent1: The regenerative process of pruning helps the tree grow stronger.
meanings.sent2: The regenerative nature of spring brings blossoms to the trees.
meanings.sent3: The regenerative dance class made her feel like a new person.
meanings.sent4: Her regenerative mindset allowed her to overcome any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The regenerative power of music lifted their spirits.

meanings.definition: Able to produce new cells or tissues
meanings.sent1: Stem cells have regenerative abilities to repair damaged tissues.
meanings.sent2: The regenerative medicine field focuses on healing through cell regeneration.
meanings.sent3: The regenerative cream promised to make her skin look younger.
meanings.sent4: The regenerative process of healing begins with the body's own cells.
meanings.sent5: The regenerative power of the body can sometimes amaze doctors.

meanings.definition: Involving the restoration of health or vitality
meanings.sent1: The regenerative therapy helped improve her overall well-being.
meanings.sent2: The regenerative effects of exercise boosted his energy levels.
meanings.sent3: The regenerative smoothie recipe claimed to revitalize the body.
meanings.sent4: The regenerative power of laughter can brighten even the darkest days.
meanings.sent5: The regenerative process of sleep is essential for maintaining health.
